headline: Italian Sausage Tortellini Bake
description: This delicious Italian baked tortellini dish will have you coming back for seconds.

video.description: Totally tasty and zesty family pasta dinner!
video.name: Italian Sausage Tortellini Bake

name: Italian Sausage Tortellini Bake

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a large pot over medium heat. Crumble sausage into the saucepan; add onion and green bell pepper. Cook and stir the sausage mixture until the sausage is completely browned, 7 to 10 minutes. Drain grease.

Pour marinara sauce and diced tomatoes over the sausage mixture; season with garlic powder and stir. Bring the mixture to a simmer, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer until the diced tomatoes break down into the sauce, 30 to 45 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook the frozen tortellini at a boil until they float to the top and the filling is hot, 6 to 7 minutes; drain.
Gently fold the cooked tortellini into the simmering sauce; cook together another 5 minutes. Pour tortellini and sauce into a 13x9-inch baking dish; top with mozzarella cheese.
Bake in preheated oven until cheese is golden brown, 20 to 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Used Italian Sausage Ravioli. I did saute the onion, green pepper and extra garlic which I added to jarred sauce. Going for a sausage,peppers and onion taste, but with some sort cuts. Topped with smoked mozzarella. Great flexable recipe which is easily personalized to taste.

a super recipe indeed!! The pop of cheesy flavor from the tortellini in combination with the flavorful sauce is a hit! I used a combination of sweet and spicy Italian sausages from the but her! I will make this again!! Thank you for the recipe!!
Love it! Quick and easy.
Made it. Delicious. Had to modify for what I had in the house And a smaller amount for two of us, but great.

This bake is very good. I skipped the green pepper and the garlic powder and used a big garlic clove instead. It was very good. I made half the recipe so I would say it might need a tid bit more than 4.5 oz of tortellini to balance the sauce/tortellini ratio.
We loved this recipe. I used sliced grilled sausage and added a little oregano and Italian seasonings. Highly recommend.
My family loved this recipe. I vodka sauce instead of marinara and the substitution was perfect!
Used tortellini - came out great
Very good and easy to put together. I used more tortellini because my package was bigger than stated - just eyeballed what looked like a good mix. Well liked by all!
Made as noted but used entire 19 oz bag frozen tortellini which seem the right ratio to me. Excellent dish.

I used prego 4 cheese and basil pasta sauce and a whole pound of frozen tortellini. Didn't cook the tort ahead. Also added some dry sage, mustard, and garlic powder to sauce. Baked for 20 minutes and then added cheese for last 10 since I hate overcooked cheese. Would definitely make again.
So good and so simple, even the picky hubby liked it ! Leftovers went quickly ! I used rope sausage since that is what I had on hand, next time I might even add a little pepperoni to it - very good !
Loved it! I made it exactly as written, halving the ingredients to feed just two of us. My husband asked for it again two days after I'd made it.

Hearty and flavorful! Took a bit longer than I normally spend on prep, so I think if I repeated this I'd do like another reviewer and skip a lot of the boiling/simmering. I tried to follow the recipe as closely as possible, the only differences being: I didn't drain the "grease" because for me it was mostly just the onion juice (your sausage may vary), I used a mozzarella/provolone blend (it's what was on hand, still worked), and I left the dish in the oven for a little less than 20 minutes because my dish was biiiiiit too small to handle the final mixture and I feared spill-over. But I should have left it in for the full time; only a tiny bit of cheese spilled over and everything else seemed to be staying in place. I should have trusted the cheese. It knew what it was doing.

EXCELLENT! Easy to make. I added some cooked spinach, chopped up some garlic and some Italian seasoning.
Everyone in the house loved this! Comfort food at its best. Thank You for a solid go-to recipe!

It turned out absolutely delicious the entire family liked it, including the picky eaters. I added a few extra seasonings to the meat peppers and onions mixture mainly Italian seasonings and cayenne pepper. Next time i think i may add some half and half or whipping cream only to make the sauce thicken a bit more and become a lil creamy under the cheese top.
It's a KEEPER in our house. Sometimes I add a little more tortellini to the recipe because 9 ounces is not enough.
Great fun dish to make with your Family.

Made this once before and it was a big hit, now I’m catering this recipe for my brother’s get together. For sure. A great hit with anyone, only change I made this time is half is made with sausage the other half no meat because he has non meat eating guests, hence the aluminum foil barrier in the middle.
Amazing flavor! One of the few new dishes I’ve tried recently that the whole family went back for seconds on!! It’s a definite recommend ??

Made this tonight and it was delicious! I added some sliced mushrooms and used a spicy sausage. My husband and I ate so much we had belly aches. I used 19oz of tortellini and divided into 2 9x9 dishes and froze one. I’ll definitely make this again!
We really enjoyed this simple dish. Easy and good. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
Made this tonight exactly per the recipe. It was delicious and easy.
This was delicious. It’s simple and I made it exactly as the recipe says. The whole family loved it. Definitely will make it again.
Delicious. Simple and tasty.
Delicious! Only change I made was adding a packet of Italian dressing mix instead of garlic.

It was so good but I did add garlic to my spicy Italian sausage mixture; and I let it simmer for about 20 minutes but served it with a salad and some Parmesan cheese and garlic bread... Didn't have no leftovers... I will be making it again.
Thank you for the recipe. It turned out nicely and tasted great !
Great flavor and taste. It seems kinda like a thick sauce with meat in it though. We bought the 50 cent bread from Jimmy John's and put it on that and it was delicious!
Tasted far better than expected, definitely a good recipe and not horribly difficult to make for beginners
Very good. Used a sprinkle of fennel seeds with the onion, not having any fennel available, and penne instead of rigatoni for the same reason. It turned out well. Will make it again.
What a delicious and easy recipe. The whole family enjoyed it, and yes, they had seconds.
Delicious and easy to make, will definitely make it again!
used 32 oz sauce, basil, oregano, italian seasoning. split in two pans (froze one). Delicious!
Exchanged to Italian sausage for smoked sausage. It was a big hit with my husband and kiddo.
Made this exactly as written! Very good and my husband loved it! He ate a second helping.
My husband and I liked this, but I used hot breakfast sausage and added more tortellini.
Followed recipes and it was delicious!!!
everyone loved it.
No green pepper here, don't care for it. Used minced garlic and omitted the garlic powder. Otherwise made this as written. A good quick meal that satisfied us. Will make this one again.
Delicious add more onion and garlic for added flavour.
I left it in the oven for too long and the cheese got a little too dark, but overall it was a good meal. I will be making it again.????
Awesome and so easy. No leftovers for tomorrow ??
This was very good! I did not summer the sauce as long as the directions said. I simmered it maybe 12-15 minutes total. I added extra garlic because I like it. Will make this again.

Great idea for an Italian dish! I tweeked it a little myself, though. Instead of marinara sauce, I used pasta sauce. When cooking the sausage with the onion and green pepper, I added some minced garlic. Also, instead of just garlic powder, I added some basil, oregano, salt, pepper, and a little bit of sugar. Perfection!
Made exactly as directed. Used Bob Evans Italian sausage and Prego Marinara. Also used refrigerated tortilla instead of frozen. We loved it! So easy and delicious!
Very good
Simple to make and the kids loved it, so it’s a win-win recipe for me! I did add more sauce, but that’s the only thing I did differently.
I added a lot of fresh tomatoes, a few smaller onions and a large pepper from my garden plus the ingredients listed. It was delish.

I followed the instructions very closely with ingredients I had on hand. I used spicy Johnsonville sausage & spinach & cheese stuffed tortellini. I did place the casserole under the broiler for a few minutes at the end which resulted in a slightly crunchy top. This recipe is easy, versatile as far as ingredients, & absolutely delicious. I baked half of the mixture and froze the rest to use for a quick dinner in the future.
I had 24 oz of tortellini so I just doubled everything. I also added mushrooms because we love them.Added some red pepper flakes as we like a little heat. Was great heated up the next day.
Turkey Sausage instead of Pork

This was not a food "revelation," but my whole family liked it, so that's a huge bonus for me.

The only thing I changed was the tortellini cook time in the pot. I only cooked them for about 3 minutes in a rolling boil, and let the sauce in the oven do the rest.

My husband loves spicy Italian sausage so I gave it a try. It was delicious!!!! My husband raved and said it was “company worthy”!! I did sprinkle in some red pepper flakes which REALLY made it hot along with the spicy sausage. Probably wouldn’t do that again. Great, great dinner!!! Will definitely make this again!!
Great! Easy and delicious. I added some baby spinach just to get a green vegetable in the sauce. Very good leftovers, too. Will definitely make again.
My grandsons said they'd like tortellini for dinner so I found this recipe. Huge hit with everyone and will become a family favorite.
Requested again in less than 1 week,family loved it.
I liked it, but my husband and daughter thought it wasn't that great.
Very good. Made as directed. The only thing is that it is a little time consuming with the cooking on stove then in the oven.
This is a pretty quick and easy recipe that is also tasty.
This is a pretty quick and easy recipe that is also tasty.
ya, I'm usually modest when I make my dinners, but this was sooo good!! I didn't have the diced tomatoes and had a red pepper instead of green, but yum yum!
I made recipe exactly as stated as I always do when trying a new one and really it was great as is. Sometimes I throw in extra veggies or spices just to get rid of them. Excellent recipe.
Made this recipe! Used ravioli instead and meatballs added lots of mushrooms and it worked just fine! Versatile...you can put other things in you may have in your fridge or freezer.
Made the recipe as written. It is now a family favorite! Leftovers freeze well.
Excellent - only change was adding a few red pepper flakes to spice up the sauce - everyone loved it and wanted the recipe! Definite keeper!
Added more garlic and left out the bell pepper (picky kiddos and boyfriend loves garlic). All in all, great recipe. My boys and boyfriend have already asked me to make it again.
I changed the recipe a little. Instead of tortellini I folded in penne . This is a easy one pan meal. I had garlic bread on the side. So good.
i subbed a sweet red pepper for green and arrabiata sauce for marinara. Very tasty. Definitely "seconds" !
I used hot Italian sausage and my husband loved this dish! I am not a fan of Italian foods, but it looked and smelled delicious. I followed the recipe to a "T" and it was a hit.
Super good!
This was amazing both my wife and I loved it and will be making it again.
Turned out perfect.. added Italian seasoning to the meat as it was cooking.. also added key west seasoning to spice it up. But the timing was right on. Used turkey Italian sausage.
I used a pound of ground venison and half pound sausage . Turned out great.
Yes, I will make it again. Family loved it!
No changes. Made as written. Very good.
Excellent,next time will use more tortellini
Very easy to make and feeds a lot , also great leftovers

This was really easy and good. I used 1pkg of spicy Italian sausage from Costco (about 1 and 1/3 lb) and refrigerated cheese tortellini from Costco. Because the tortellini had already been precooked, I eliminated the boiling process (and an extra pot to clean!). Will probably double the garlic next time since my family really loves it. If you like your pasta saucy, you will want to keep covered during the simmering and possibly add a bit of water to it. Make sure to stir a few times during simmering too. This was super simple, and a great, hearty weeknight meal. Thanks for the recipe!!!
Didn't change a thing and it was delicious!! Hubby LOVED it!!

Delicious!!! Made this a few nights ago and my family and I loved it! I made a few adjustments but only because of our families personal taste preferences. I added half of a small can of tomato paste to the tomato mixture, used half an onion, and used fresh mozzarella pearls mixed in with the mixture prior to topping it with shredded mozzarella and baking. Was phenomenal!

I made this a few times already :) the first time I made it as the recipe said to and the sausage I used had a spice to it so my daughter wasn't a fan but the rest of my family loved it! So the next time I followed the recipe again except I used maple sausage. And everyone loved it once again! Except this time so did my daughter :) great recipe. I have added this to our family favorites!
Giving this 5 stars for creativity. Not sure tortellini is the right noodle for a baked dish, but plenty of good ideas in this recipe to improvise with.

I simplified the recipe by using a jar of chunky tomato pasta sauce with garlic and onions already in it. I used Shady Brook Farm's Hot Italian Turkey Sausage which is took out of the casing and broke up as I browned it. Then I added the pasta sauce. I used one pound of frozen cheese tortellini cooked according to the instructions on the package. Those three ingredients were combined and poured into the baking pan. About one and a half cups of shredded mozzarella were used - two just seemed like too much to me. I baked as directed in the original recipe and it came out great! My husband really liked it, too. I will definitely make this again.
Awesome!

My six year old decided he wanted to make dinner "all by himself," and he and I poked around the Allrecipes website until we agreed on this recipe. I subbed in a bag of frozen bell peppers and onions, so he wouldn't have to cut anything, and the bag of tortellini we used was larger than 9 oz...16 oz maybe? Anyway, we used the whole thing. It came out really well, everyone ate a ton, and my six year old thinks he's the chef of the year. Thanks for the recipe.

This was great! Made it almost as written. I used Barilla 3 cheese tortellini bc I couldn't find frozen tortellini, I just cooked that according to the pasta package and then mixed it in. I also didn't use all the marinara, but I would next time. Its important to let the marinara, peppers and onions simmer together to reduce water content. DONT SKIP that, but if you don't have time, just add less marinara sauce and I think it would compensate. This was delicious. My kids loved it, hubs loved it. Great recipe.
I used 1/2 lb. mild italian sausage and 1/2 lb. spicy italian sausage and used Imo's Pizza Provel cheese instead of mozarella. Delicious!
I increased the amount of tortellini, and reduced the amount of sausage, and it worked fine.

Super easy and very delicious Followed the recipe exactly except I used a bigger (20 oz maybe ) package of tortellini. There was plenty of sauce and cheese to cover. I served it with a tossed salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing. Will definitely make this again.
This was good. I didn't put in the green pepper and the diced tomatoes. I just didn't think the recipe needed it. I did add some oregano and basil since I didn't use the Italian tomatoes.
Instead of garlic powder, I added 2 garlic cloves crushed. Also added fresh mushrooms. Delicious!! My family LOVED IT! I
New family favorite!

I loved this! I made changes out of ease and personal preference. I used Prego sauce instead of tomatoes. I skipped the bell pepper and added minced garlic. Very delicious! I'm making it again tonight!
Just perfect and filling....absolutely delicious!

Very good recipe! I was looking for a new way to do some tortellini and I thought a bake would be good! I changed this up A LOT actually but same basic concept. I'm from east Texas so I put some of my natural flavoring to it and actually used deer meat that I marinated in Pinot noir and balsamic. Also added black olives right before I put it in the pan to bake. Turned out amazing though! The black olives are a great touch! Good recipe though!!
We make a LOT of Italian and this was up there as one if my favs. I added some basil and oregano when adding the sauce but otherwise perfect!
Tasty! I didn't really have to change anything, though I did use the Johnsonville sausage as well. Just what was available to me.
Delicious and easy!!
